projects.name: Remindu
projects.intro: A Vue.js app to tackle food expiration problems
projects.description:
Project Background:
In daily life, we often waste food because we forget expiration dates. Remindu was born from this common problem.

Requirements:
Design a food management app that helps users track food inventory, record expiration dates, and alert users in advance. The app needs to support multi-device access, data synchronization, and a user-friendly interface.

Development Process:
1. Built a responsive frontend interface using Vue.js with component-based development
2. Developed backend APIs with Python to handle business logic and data validation
3. Used AWS database to store user data and food information
4. Implemented routing navigation and state management to optimize user experience
5. Designed responsive layouts to adapt to different screen sizes

Key Technologies:
- Vue.js component architecture and reactive data binding
- RESTful API design and implementation
- AWS RDS database design and optimization
- CSS Grid and Flexbox for responsive layouts

Development Challenges:
- Implementation of real-time reminders and push notification mechanisms
- Query optimization and pagination for large amounts of food data
- Consistency issues in cross-device data synchronization
- User interface adaptation across different devices

Project Results:
The project has been successfully deployed and launched. Users can access and use all features through the web interface. The application interface is clean and beautiful, with smooth operation that effectively helps users manage food inventory.

Project Status:
The project is publicly available and can be accessed at http://remindu.net/#/

projects.name: Python Plants vs. Zombies
projects.intro: Implemented parts of Plants vs. Zombies using Python and the CMU Graphics library
projects.description:
Project Background:
This was a project assignment for CMU 15-112 course, aimed at learning and mastering Python programming and GUI development through recreating classic games.

Requirements:
Implement a reverse gameplay version of Plants vs. Zombies where players control and deploy zombies to eat plants. The game needs to implement zombie deployment system, combat system, point reward system, and command system.

Development Process:
1. Built game interface and rendering system using CMU Graphics library
2. Designed game object classes (Plant, Zombie, etc.)
3. Implemented player-controlled zombie deployment interaction system
4. Developed collision detection and combat logic, where zombies eat plants to earn points
5. Implemented point system to track player scores
6. Developed command system supporting clear operations and plant generation at specific locations
7. Optimized game performance to ensure smooth operation

Key Technologies:
- Object-oriented programming (OOP) design and class inheritance
- Graphics rendering and animation systems
- Collision detection algorithms
- Game state management and event handling
- User interaction and command parsing
- Timers and periodic events

Development Challenges:
- Performance optimization for multiple objects moving and interacting simultaneously
- Balancing collision detection accuracy and efficiency
- Command system parsing and execution
- Game balance adjustments (zombie damage, plant health, etc.)
- Complex game state management and transitions

Project Results:
The project fully implemented the reverse gameplay core functionality. Players can control zombie deployment and eat plants to earn points. The command system runs stably, and the game flow is smooth with clear graphics. Players can experience unique gameplay.

Project Status:
The project is open source, with code hosted on GitHub, and demo videos available on YouTube.

projects.name: Daily Guessing Challenge Refresher
projects.intro: Refreshes previous questions so the 'Guess Salt' daily challenge can vary randomly
projects.description:
Project Background:
On xiaoce.fun website, the 'Guess Salt Daily Challenge' only has one question per day. Users wanted to review previous questions. Meanwhile, the original plugin had limited functionality, supporting only the 'Guess Salt' module.

Requirements:
Extend the original plugin functionality to: 1) Call historical questions and implement question refresh functionality; 2) Support multiple modules (Guess Salt, Guess Farmer, Guess Porridge); 3) Maintain the ease of use of the original plugin.

Development Process:
1. Analyzed the API structure and data format of xiaoce.fun website
2. Studied the code architecture and implementation of the original plugin
3. Designed new functional modules to implement historical question calling
4. Extended the plugin to support multiple challenge modules
5. Tested compatibility and stability across different modules
6. Optimized code structure to improve maintainability

Key Technologies:
- Browser extension development and DOM manipulation
- RESTful API calls and data parsing
- JavaScript asynchronous programming and Promise handling
- Local storage and state management

Development Challenges:
- Reverse engineering the website API to understand data request formats
- Handling API differences and data format variations across different modules
- Ensuring the plugin doesn't interfere with the original website's normal functionality
- Handling network request failures and exceptions

Project Results:
The plugin successfully implemented all expected features. Users can now use the refresh function to review historical questions and support multiple challenge modules. The plugin runs stably with good user experience.

Project Status:
The project is open source, with code hosted on GitHub, available for other developers to reference and improve.

projects.name: F18 Super Hornet Maker
projects.intro: Redesigns the F-18 cockpit console by moving from breadboards to PCB for stability, integration and visual coherence via engineering iterations.
projects.description:
Project Background:
The F-18 Super Hornet fighter cockpit console prototype was initially built on a breadboard. Although fully functional, it had issues with poor stability, large size, and difficulty in maintenance. It needed to be converted to a professional PCB.

Requirements:
1. Convert breadboard circuit to PCB design to improve system stability and reliability
2. Optimize circuit layout to reduce size and improve integration
3. Maintain original functional completeness
4. Design an architecture that is easy to maintain and extend

Development Process:
1. Analyzed circuit connections and functional modules of the breadboard prototype
2. Used EDA tools (such as KiCad) to design PCB schematic
3. Performed PCB layout design, optimizing traces and component placement
4. Considered electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) and signal integrity
5. Wrote Arduino program to implement control logic
6. PCB manufacturing and assembly
7. System testing and debugging

Key Technologies:
- PCB design principles and routing rules
- C++ embedded programming and Arduino development
- Digital signal processing and I/O control
- Circuit simulation and testing methods

Development Challenges:
- Circuit conversion and optimization from breadboard to PCB
- Signal integrity assurance and interference suppression for high-frequency signals
- Component selection and package design
- Real-time performance and stability of embedded programs
- PCB manufacturing process limitations and design constraints

Project Results:
Successfully completed the conversion from breadboard to PCB. The newly designed PCB is smaller, more stable, and fully meets functional expectations. The console runs stably and all indicators meet design requirements.

Project Status:
Project details can be viewed on the Yungu platform, including complete design documents and test reports.

projects.name: Building a Distributed Service with AWS and Python
projects.intro: Builds an elastic computing system with AWS & Python for scalable digit recognition, balancing load dynamically to avoid backlog and waste.
projects.description:
Project Background:
Traditional digit recognition services often face performance bottlenecks when handling large concurrent requests, with low resource utilization. There was a need to build a distributed system capable of automatic scaling to handle traffic fluctuations.

Requirements:
1. Implement high-precision digit recognition functionality
2. Build a distributed architecture supporting horizontal scaling
3. Implement dynamic load balancing to automatically distribute requests
4. Design a queue system to handle traffic bursts
5. Optimize resource utilization to reduce costs

Development Process:
1. Developed digit recognition algorithms and server programs using Python
2. Deployed AWS EC2 instances, configuring multiple server nodes
3. Implemented load balancer to distribute requests across different nodes
4. Designed queue system (such as SQS) to handle request queuing
5. Developed auto-scaling strategy to adjust instance count based on load
6. Used AWS RDS to store recognition results and logs
7. Developed web frontend interface supporting image upload and result display
8. Conducted stress testing and performance optimization

Key Technologies:
- AWS cloud services (EC2, RDS, SQS, ELB) configuration and usage
- Python backend development and RESTful API design
- Machine learning model deployment and inference optimization
- Distributed system design and message queues
- Frontend development (HTML, JavaScript) and user interface design
- Database design and query optimization

Development Challenges:
- State synchronization and consistency guarantees in distributed systems
- Load balancing algorithm design and tuning
- Auto-scaling strategy threshold setting and response speed
- Prevention and handling of queue backlog issues
- Balance between cost control and performance
- Cross-service error handling and fault tolerance mechanisms

Project Results:
The system was successfully deployed and running, capable of handling large concurrent requests and automatically adjusting resources based on load. Digit recognition accuracy is high, response speed is fast, and user experience is good. System stability is high, and resource utilization has been significantly improved.

Project Status:
The project is open source, with code hosted on GitHub, including complete technical documentation and deployment instructions.

projects.name: Alibaba International Olympic Day - Robot Sports Meet
projects.intro: Built, programmed and tuned the PID parameters to keep the robot balance, enabling the robot to run on a 3.5-kilometer sports field.
projects.description:
Project Background:
In June 2025, Alibaba, as a Worldwide Olympic Partner, held events at its Hangzhou headquarters to celebrate International Olympic Day. The activities included a 3.5-kilometer run, AI robot demonstrations, and other events aimed at promoting fitness, inclusion, and innovation.

Requirements:
Design and implement 15 AI-powered robots that need to: 1) Maintain autonomous balance; 2) Follow participants and run together; 3) Demonstrate innovative applications of AI in sports; 4) Run stably at the event site.

Development Process:
1. Developed based on others' robot designs and code framework
2. Robot hardware assembly and sensor configuration (gyroscope, accelerometer, etc.)
3. Developed robot control program using Python
4. Implemented PID (Proportional-Integral-Derivative) control algorithm to maintain robot balance
5. Improved robot stability through repeated experiments and PID parameter tuning
6. On-site testing and debugging to ensure stability in complex environments
7. Deployment and operation during the event

Key Technologies:
- PID control algorithm principles and parameter tuning
- Robot kinematics and dynamics modeling
- Sensor data fusion and filtering
- Python embedded programming and real-time control
- Machine learning applications in control parameter optimization

Development Challenges:
- Manual PID parameter tuning was very time-consuming, requiring extensive experiments
- Differences in robot balance performance under different ground conditions
- Multi-robot collaborative operation communication and coordination
- Real-time fault handling and recovery at the event site
- Stability and durability for long-duration operation

Project Results:
All 15 AI robots successfully participated in the event, demonstrating excellent balance and following capabilities. The robots not only completed the running task but also became highlights of the event, attracting significant attention. Media reports called them 'a group of unusual runners', reflecting the perfect combination of technology and sports.

Project Status:
This was an internal Alibaba event project. Related news has been published on the International Olympic Committee official website. The event successfully showcased the robots' performance in the sports field.
